Subject: Question
Description:
Hi,

The console port and client ports communicate on port 443. 

Is there any chance for me to separate them? For example, I want to use 443 when accessing the console, but I want to use a different port when the clients communicate with the server.

Can you tell me how to do it?

Best regards
What_We_Know__c:
Connected remote along with Daniel to change the IP port.
We encountered a problem with the tests initially but after going to the sysctl.conf from /etc/sysctl.conf we added net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind = 1 and tested again.

Client was successfully able to connect
Next_Steps__c: Will have to investigate as I've read in the backend procedures there procedure 35 but need a confirmation.
